content.webTitle: Flooding and traffic chaos as winter bites

fields.headline: Flooding and traffic chaos as winter bites
fields.bodyText: While shoppers in Wales were buying daffodils a fortnight earlier than last year because of the mild winter weather, heavy rainfall and snow in parts of western England, the Midlands and Yorkshire this weekend left homes flooded and motorists stranded in their cars. Among the worst hit areas were Bristol, Gloucestershire, Wiltshire and Somerset, where pupils at a village primary school were left marooned after a flooded road cut off access to the building on Friday. Parts of the M5 were closed, causing major delays to drivers, and there were flight cancellations at Bristol International Airport and train diversions.
